performances.description: The whole band is on fire...  this is what made fall '89 one of their best tours.
A rocking version.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Go deaf blasting this it's totally worth it
The entire show is PERFECTION, but you've got to hear the transition from Wheel into Gimme Some Lovin. They just nail it. Best version ever

performances.venue: Blossom Music Center Cuyahoga Falls, OH
performances.description: DAMN Phil

performances.venue: Long Beach Arena Long Beach, CA

performances.description: Brent and phil having a blast and playing and singing their asses off! The Hammond gets an extensive workout from Brent on this absolutely fun time!
"So Glad You Made It"- Considered it a personal invitation.  The first version has to be on the list.  We had heard that Phil was going to break out a
Nice bonus tune in the post drums
Start to set 3
Apollo 90 mammoth Gimme some lovin. Rolex and a bump add to yer bombin' stew for this
Great version from a terrific show
Great Phil Vocals and Jerry rips it

performances.venue: Brendan Bryne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: Roars out of space! I was there. Does that count for anything?
Wonderful energy from Phil and Brent. Crowd is going nuts
How is this not here?  Second set opener with Spencer Davis singing.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: From Bruce Hornsby's first show as a member this is the only version without Brent.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
performances.description: Brent and Phil sheer madness and fun a great rocking good time with excellent performance from Brent and Phil.

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Wailin' B-3 Paradise
fun show opener, typical philly vibe
Phil & Brent take over the show and get groovy.
Scorching way to open a 2nd set!
double dose of I-95 summer adolescent escapade brent and phil frat house. Shit hot
Hot one that segues nicely into Watchtower
Thunders and stomps mightily out of Space into a scorching Wharf Rat....
Lovin' -> Half-Step to open. Punchy, rocking combo.
I liked the intro coming out of space plus the vocals didn’t make my ears bleed
They take their time for the intro. Right out of space into this Spencer Davis cover. Brent is the MAN!!! Phil in top form too of course :)
Pretty sick
Cool transition from "Space," and the organ in the intro is hot. Leads into a smoking "Watchtower"

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: barrels in and kicks ass. Definitely some  first show of the year magic on this. Revives the blues/soul energy of set 1 to leave us smilin' and dancin
Hilarious response by Phil to the "Let Phil sing" chants at the top of this show. "Make Phil sing"?

performances.venue: World Music Theater Tinley Park, IL
performances.description: Well my temperature's risin', got my feet on the floor
Boisterous. Stomps out of the Wheel into a great Dew.
Spring '89 also rocked, give this one a listen.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Passionate vocals from Phil and Brent.
Feels so good! Rips out of Wheel and the crowd is throwing it back. Brent in top form vocally. Heady
This one blasts straight outta space & into yer body... Brent pours everything he's got into this tune, god bless 'em.
Brent and Phil having an absolute blast, Fun high energy set 3 opener.
